longTitle.p: Set targets for the years 2050, 2040 and 2030 for the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions; to provide for a system of carbon budgeting; to provide for reporting and statements against those targets and budgets; to confer power to impose climate change reporting duties on public bodies; to provide for reports and advice from the Committee on Climate Change; and for connected purposes.

section.heading: Meaning of “net Northern Ireland emissions account” for a year

intro.p: The net Northern Ireland emissions account for a year is determined as follows⁠—

content.p: take the aggregate amount of net Northern Ireland emissions of each greenhouse gas for that year (which is to be determined in accordance with sections 7 and 8),

intro.p: The amount of net Northern Ireland emissions of a greenhouse gas for a period is⁠—

content.p: the amount of Northern Ireland emissions of the gas for the period (see subsection (2)),

intro.p: The Northern Ireland emissions of a gas for a period are—

content.p: emissions of the gas from sources in Northern Ireland in the period, and

emissions of the gas from international aviation or international shipping that count as Northern Ireland emissions for the period (as determined by regulations under section 8).

intro.p: The Northern Ireland removals of a gas for a period are removals of the gas from the atmosphere in the period due to—

content.p: land use in Northern Ireland;
land-use change in Northern Ireland; and

The Department may by regulations amend subsection (3) so as to amend the definition of Northern Ireland removals.

The amounts of Northern Ireland emissions and Northern Ireland removals of a gas for a period must be determined consistently with international carbon reporting practice (see section Error: Reference source not found).

section.heading: Meaning of “Northern Ireland emissions”: international aviation and shipping

content.p: The Department may by regulations make provision for emissions of a greenhouse gas from international aviation or international shipping to count as Northern Ireland emissions of the gas.
specify activities which are to be regarded as international aviation or international shipping;

specify the circumstances in which, and the extent to which, emissions of a greenhouse gas from international aviation or international shipping are to count as Northern Ireland emissions of that gas;
specify the period (whether past or future) for which emissions of a greenhouse gas from international aviation or international shipping are to count as Northern Ireland emissions of that gas;

make provision about how emissions of a greenhouse gas from international aviation or international shipping are to be taken into account in determining Northern Ireland emissions of that gas for the year specified in section 5(1) in relation to it.
